intro: Callistachys tetragona, commonly known as the four-cornered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its four-angled stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Callistachys tetragona is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
